section.title: New Features
section.p: Eucalyptus 3.4.0 introduces the following new features.

row.entry: Eucalyptus now supports VMware and KVM in the same cloud. For more information, see ....
We updated our image management content.
Eucalyptus now has limited support for STS.
Eucalyptus no longer requires that you shut down instances when you upgrade.
We added new sections to our documentation: Security Guide, Hybrid Guide, and schema documentation.
Deregistered images now automatically cleaned up

Users no longer have to run the euca-deregister command twice. Deregistered images will be automatically cleaned up in the background with an interval configured by a new property in euca.conf: cloud.images.cleanupperiod = 10m
The default value is 10 minutes. An image can only be cleaned up once it is no longer in use by any instances.
The cloud administrator can pass verbose to euca-describe-images to see the deregistered images, they will not otherwise be shown. The cloud administrator can also run the deregister command twice to force an immediate attempt at image cleanup.
